page.title: 12WOKINGHAM _ POLITICS
page.content: The 3 levels of local government are {Town Council, District Council}and{ {County Council,}all with a Conservative majority. Electoral wards each elects 3 members to the town council. The real local power is in the hands of the District and County Councils. The 3 major {Political parties} fought the l985 District election, the {Conservatives}winning 9 seats, the { {Alliance}4 and{Labour}none. On the 76 seat County Council the Conservatives have a majority of 8. The sitting{Parliamentary member}is Sir William Van Straubenzee (conservative). The most controversial{political {issues}are Hesseltown, a project involving Housing development in the area, and high unemployment. { }
